intro: Debregeasia velutina, commonly known as the velvet tree, is a species of flowering plant native to East Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, velvety bark and dark green, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in panicles, often blooming in the dry season. Its fruit is a small, three-lobed capsule that contains several seeds. Debregeasia velutina is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient plant in its native habitat.
